intro: Micromeria kerneri, commonly known as the Kern's micromeria, is a small, annual herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has a short life cycle, flowering and setting seed within a single growing season. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
